com.datamelt.util

Class VelocityDataWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.datamelt.util.VelocityDataWriter

  • public class VelocityDataWriter
extends Object
    Utility class to merge objects and a Apche Velocity template to a ASCII based output. The format will be specified in external velocity templates.
    Author:
    uwegeercken

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      static String HTML_FILE_EXTENSION

      static String XML_FILE_EXTENSION 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      VelocityDataWriter(String templatePath, String templateName)
      constructor for velocity datawriter class expects the path and the name of a template

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addObject(Object object)
      add an object to a hashtable of objects so that they can be processed at a later stage. the object gets a default name of: dbObject which identifies it in a velocity template
      void addObject(String objectName, Object object)
      add an object to a hashtable of objects so that they can be processed at a later stage. the objectName argument will be that name which is used in the velocity template to identify the object
      private String adjustPath(String path)
      adjusts a given path to that it has a trailing forward slash in case it does not have a trailing forward slash.
      void clearObjects()
      removes all objects that had been passed to this datawriter object
      String getTemplateName()
      returns the name of the template
      String getTemplatePath()
      the path to the velocity templates
      String merge()
      merges all objects that have been passed to this writer with the given template and returns the resulting string representation.
      void reInit(String templateName)
      re-initializes the datawriter with a new template. this is useful to re-use an existing datawriter object
      void setOutputStream(PrintStream out)
      sets the output stream of the writer
      void setTemplateName(String templateName)
      sets the name of the template to be used
      void setTemplatePath(String path)
      sets the path where the template may be found
      void write()
      first merges the objects that have been passed to this datawriter object with the velocity template and then writes the output to the given outputstream
      void write(String path, String fileName)
      first merges the objects that have been passed to this datawriter object with the velocity template and then writes the output to the given path and file. the filename is amended to contain the current timestamp.

      • VelocityDataWriter

        public VelocityDataWriter(String templatePath,
                          String templateName)
                   throws Exception
        constructor for velocity datawriter class expects the path and the name of a template
        Parameters:
        templatePath - the path to the location of the template file
        templateName - the name of the template file
        Throws:
        Exception - exception if the template engine can not be initialized

    • Method Detail

      • reInit

        public void reInit(String templateName)
            throws Exception
        re-initializes the datawriter with a new template. this is useful to re-use an existing datawriter object
        Parameters:
        templateName - the name of the velocity template to be used
        Throws:
        Exception - exception if the template was not found

      • clearObjects

        public void clearObjects()
        removes all objects that had been passed to this datawriter object

        sets the output stream of the writer
        Parameters:

      • addObject

        public void addObject(String objectName,
                      Object object)
        add an object to a hashtable of objects so that they can be processed at a later stage. the objectName argument will be that name which is used in the velocity template to identify the object
        Parameters:
        objectName - the name of the object to be added
        object - the object to be added

      • addObject

        public void addObject(Object object)
        add an object to a hashtable of objects so that they can be processed at a later stage. the object gets a default name of: dbObject which identifies it in a velocity template
        Parameters:
        object - the object to be added

      • merge

        public String merge()
             throws Exception
        merges all objects that have been passed to this writer with the given template and returns the resulting string representation.
        Returns:
        the String representation from the merge of the objects and the template
        Throws:
        Exception - exception if the merge of the objects and the template was unsuccessful

      • write

        public void write(String path,
                  String fileName)
           throws Exception
        first merges the objects that have been passed to this datawriter object with the velocity template and then writes the output to the given path and file. the filename is amended to contain the current timestamp.
        Parameters:
        path - the path where the file shall be written
        fileName - the name of the file that shall be produced
        Throws:
        Exception - exception if the file can not be produced

      • write

        public void write()
           throws Exception
        first merges the objects that have been passed to this datawriter object with the velocity template and then writes the output to the given outputstream
        Throws:
        Exception - exception if the file can not be produced

      • adjustPath

        private String adjustPath(String path)
        adjusts a given path to that it has a trailing forward slash in case it does not have a trailing forward slash.
        Parameters:
        path - a given path
        Returns:
        the path with a trailing slash character
